Class WalkableTile

java.lang.Object
model.Tile
model.WalkableTile
public class WalkableTile extends Tile
Represents a tile that the Hero can freely walk on.

This tile type is always non-blocking and is used to represent empty floor space. A walkable tile:

  • is always destructible, though destroying it simply keeps it walkable,
  • can be temporarily set to non-walkable when a bomb occupies it,
  • uses the space character (' ') to represent open floor in rendering.

In traditional Bomberman mechanics, when a bomb is placed on a walkable tile, the hero cannot immediately step back onto that tile until the bomb explodes. This behavior is implemented via the setWalkable(boolean) method.

      The character used to visually represent a walkable tile on the board. A space character (' ') indicates open floor.

  • Method Details

    • isWalkable

      public boolean isWalkable()
      Indicates whether this tile is currently walkable by the hero or other entities.
      Specified by:
      isWalkable in class Tile
      Returns:
      true if the tile allows movement; false otherwise

    • setWalkable

      public void setWalkable(boolean walkability)
      Updates whether this tile should be considered walkable.

      This is used when bombs temporarily block entry to the tile.

      Specified by:
      setWalkable in class Tile
      Parameters:
      walkability - true to make the tile walkable again; false to block movement temporarily

      Returns the character representing this tile's type.
